algorithm_technique: Count occurrences of rows and columns using hash maps (Counters) and compare.
Convert rows and columns to tuples to use them as hashable keys.
problem_summary_simple: Count pairs of identical rows and columns in a square matrix.
problem_summary_technical: Uses hash maps to store frequencies of row tuples and column tuples, then finds common keys.
key_insights: The problem requires comparing sequences (rows and columns) for equality.
Hash tables (specifically `collections.Counter`) are efficient for counting occurrences of these sequences.
Tuples are used as keys in the hash table because lists are not hashable.
